intro: Eupodium pittieri, commonly known as the Mexican sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. It produces small, often pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Eupodium pittieri is often found in rocky soils and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
